intro: Fendlerella utahensis, commonly known as the Utah fendlerbloom, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Utah and neighboring states. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often appearing in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Fendlerella utahensis plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and provides nectar for pollinators.
